name: Disabled Veteran Property Tax Exemption
description: Property tax exemption up to $241,627 assessed value for disabled veterans; based on disability rating and income
fullDescription: California offers one of the nation's most valuable property tax exemptions for disabled veterans. The exemption can eliminate thousands in annual property taxes based on disability rating and income level.
whatTheyOffer:
- Full or partial property tax exemption
- Basic exemption up to $161,083 (2024) for 100% disabled
- Low-income exemption up to $241,627 (2024) for qualifying veterans
- Applies to primary residence only
- Unmarried surviving spouses may also qualify
- Annual savings can be thousands of dollars
howToGetIt:
1. Must have service-connected disability from VA
2. Must be California resident
3. Property must be primary residence
4. File claim with County Assessor's Office
5. Provide VA disability rating letter and DD214
6. Renew annually with county
keywords: disabled veteran, property tax exemption, VA disability, service-connected disability, property tax relief, homeowner, tax savings, surviving spouse, county assessor
